properties.Info: Founded by the de Rolo family, the city of Whitestone gets its name from the miraculous mineral that is the city's chief export.
properties.Name: Whitestone

properties.Info:
Meaning "mountain city" in elvish, Lyrengorn is the last bastion of safety before the endless
ice of the Neverfields to the north.
properties.Name: Lyrengorn

properties.Info: Sheltered within a cauldron-like valley miles deep into the northern mountain range, the village of Terrah is home to the Ashari people that watch over the rift to the Elemental Plane of Earth.
properties.Name: Terrah

properties.Info:
Heralded as the true living center of dwarven culture
on the continent, the stronghold of Kraghammer is an autonomous city-state built upon rich veins of platinum and mithral.
properties.Name: Kraghammer

properties.Info: Silver veins in the nearby rocky hills caused a population boom for the once tiny pioneer town of Jorenn Village.
properties.Name: Jorenn Village

properties.Info:
The city of Westruun is the center of Tal’Dorei, a
crossroads of culture along the Silvercut Roadway that
welcomes adventurers, traders, and vagabonds of all
kinds.
properties.Name: Westruun

properties.Info: The small farming community of Turst Fields is a hot spot for trade caravans, as it is one of the main sources for food and produce in all of Tal'Dorei.
properties.Name: Turst Fields

properties.Info: Thriving on bountiful wildlife around Mooren Lake, the town of Drynna is responsible for most of the freshwater fish supply in eastern Tal'Dorei.
properties.Name: Drynna

properties.Info: At the top of one of a mountain in the Summit Peaks, Zephrah is the tribal home of the Air Ashari people who keep watch over a gate into the Elemental Plane of Air.
properties.Name: Zephrah

properties.Info: Known as the "Rotted Lot" by passing sailors and merchants, Stilben is the largest port city on the eastern coast of Tal'Dorei and is the focal point for all trade to the East.
properties.Name: Stilben

properties.Info:
The city of Kymal stands as the grumbling ghost of a
gold rush mining center now become a haven for gamblers
and criminals.
properties.Name: Kymal

properties.Info: Emon is the cultural heart of human civilization on Tal'Dorei and is the nexus of politics, justice, business, industry, and education within the realm.
properties.Name: Emon

properties.Info:
Originally established by the elves of Syngorn as a
hidden outpost to keep watch over the growing empire
of Drassig, the Emerald Outpost now stands as a trade post between Emon and Syngorn.
properties.Name: Emerald Outpost

properties.Info:
Founded by the sorceress Yenlara in the wake of the
Divergence, Syngorn marked the first major point of elven
civilization on Tal’Dorei following its calamitous destruction.
properties.Name: Syngorn

properties.Info: A shadow of a greater time, Bronbog is now only recognized for its access to the rare swamp fungus, queenscap.
properties.Name: Bronbog

properties.Info: Hdar-Fye is the necropolis of Princ Hdar and swears fealty to the Iron Emperor in Tz'Arrm as a entity underneath the Iron Authority.
properties.Name: Hdar-Fye

properties.Info: Known as the eyrie of the red pegasi, the city-state of Ezordam-Haar is underneath the Iron Authority.
properties.Name: Ezordam-Haar

properties.Info: Ruled by the Iron Emperor, the hobgoblin city of Tz'Arrm is meticulously ordered and hellishly hot.
properties.Name: Tz'Arrm

properties.Info: Rybad-Kol, the city of the Forge Lords, is a hobgoblin city under the rule of the Iron Authority.
properties.Name: Rybad-Kol

properties.Info: Inside the trunk of a petrified elven tree, the city of Ortem-Vellak is governed under the mighty hobgoblin empire, the Iron Authority.
properties.Name: Ortem-Vellak

properties.Info: The northernmost, and second-largest community in the Mornset Countryside, Byroden borders the Gladepools and marks the first stop for any traveler endeavoring to traverse the Rifenmist.
properties.Name: Byroden

properties.Info: Devastated by the Scattered War, O'Noa was once a great colony for the first human visitors of Tal'Dorei. A small community of criminals, addicts, and opportunists have settled in the derelict city of what is now called New O'Noa.
properties.Name: O'Noa
